revised_title: A Catalogue of Nebulae and Clusters of Stars in the Southern Hemisphere
tldr: James Dunlop catalogs nebulae and star clusters in the southern hemisphere, observed at Paramatta in New South Wales, using an 9-feet reflecting telescope. The observations were made in the open air, and the data is arranged in the order of their south polar distances and right ascension. This catalogue provides valuable information about the southern sky and contributes to the knowledge of the celestial objects in that region.
